Package game

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Game
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RummyGame
    public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    A generic multi-player game, which may be sub-classed to implement a real game. The game is responsible for interacting with the players, and for enforcing the rules of the game.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      protected boolean gameStarted
      Tells whether the game has started.
      protected GamePlayer[] player
      The array of players that are playing the game.
      protected int playerCount
      The number of players that are presently playing the game.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game()
        Constructor for the GameImpl class. After creation, the game is not ready to be played until the setPlayers method has been called to tell the game who its players are.

    • Method Detail

      • initializeGame

        protected abstract void initializeGame()
        Initializes the game. This method is called just before the game is started. Subclasses should put such initialization behavior here.

      • gameOver

        public abstract boolean gameOver()
        Tells whether the game is over. Each specific game should be able to tell whether the game is over. The algorithm for determining such should be put here.
        Returns:
        Boolean value that tells whether the game is over

      • canMove

        protected abstract boolean canMove​(GamePlayer gp)
        Tells whether a given player is allowed to make a move at the present time.
        Parameters:
        gp - the player we're interested in
        Returns:
        true if the player may make a move at the present time.

      • canQuit

        protected abstract boolean canQuit​(GamePlayer gp)
        Tells whether a given player is allowed to quit the game at the present time.
        Parameters:
        gp - the player we're interested in
        Returns:
        true if the player may quit the game

      • getState

        public final GameState getState​(GamePlayer p,
                                int stateType)
        Gets information about the state of the game. Only gives information if the given player is allowed to know that information. (Typically, the GameState object will be a subclass of GameState that applies to that particular game.) If stateType is -1, it gets the player's numeric id. Subclasses should override the getGameState method to specialize state-getting behavior.
        Parameters:
        p - the player asking the question
        stateType - a game-dependent encoding, specifying the particular type of information the player wants
        Returns:
        an object that contains the information that the caller requested

      • getGameState

        protected abstract GameState getGameState​(GamePlayer p,
                                          int stateType)
        Gets information about the state of the game. Only gives information if the given player is allowed to know that information. Subclasses should override this method to specialize its behavior based on the particular game that is being played. (The handling of the -1 stateType is done in the public getState method.)
        Parameters:
        p - the player asking the question
        stateType - a game-dependent encoding, specifying the particular type of information the player wants
        Returns:
        an object that contains the information that the caller requested

      • makeMove

        protected abstract boolean makeMove​(GamePlayer thePlayer,
                                    GameMoveAction move)
        Requests that a move be made on behalf of a player. Typically, the player that wants to make the move creates a MoveAction object that encodes the move he wants to make, and then calls this method, passing itself as the player object. As long as the player does not allow any other player to know who it is (which is typical), no other player can make a move on this player's behalf because it does not have a reference to that player, and therefore cannot pass it as a parameter. This method should check that the given player is allowed to make the specified move before actually performing the move.
        Parameters:
        thePlayer - The player wishing to make the move.
        move - The move object that encodes the requested move
        Returns:
        true if the move was successfully made; false it it's an illegal move.

      • setPlayers

        public java.lang.String setPlayers​(GamePlayer[] players)
        Tells the game which players are playing.(Typically called by the GameDriver object after the players and game have been created.) Checks that the array consists of a set of players that can legally play the game (e.g., not too many or too few).
        Parameters:
        players - array of players playing the game
        Returns:
        null if game set up properly; an error message if there was a problem

      • playGame

        public void playGame()
        Plays a generic game. (An actual game will be played by a subclass object.) Initializes the game; waits for all players to tell it that they are ready; continually processes requests from the players until the game is over.

      • nullPlayersAllowed

        public abstract boolean nullPlayersAllowed()
        tells whether the group of player may contain "empty" positions such as in a poker game when there are empty chairs
        Returns:
        tells whether game may have null players

      • minPlayersAllowed

        public abstract int minPlayersAllowed()
        the minimum number of players a game can have
        Returns:
        the fewest number of players allowed

      • maxPlayersAllowed

        public abstract int maxPlayersAllowed()
        the maximum number of players a game can have
        Returns:
        the highest number of players allowed

      • indexOf

        protected int indexOf​(GamePlayer p)
        Tells the numeric position of a player in the game
        Parameters:
        p - the player
        Returns:
        the numeric position of the player in the game, -1 if the player is not part of the game

      • applyAction

        public void applyAction​(GameAction action)
        Applies an action to the Game object.Typically called by a player who wants to request an action on its behalf.
        Parameters:
        action - player requesting the action

      • handleTimerEvent

        protected void handleTimerEvent()
        Handles a timer event. By default, the method does nothing. However, for games that require a timer, this method provides a place to put the behavior to perform whenever a time event occurs.

      • performAfterAllAreReady

        protected void performAfterAllAreReady()
        Performs game-specific action that needs to be done after all players are ready (e.g., initializing timers).

      • notifyAllStateChanged

        protected final void notifyAllStateChanged()
        Notifies all players that the state has changed. Performs each notification in a separate thread so that players don't have to wait for one another

      • performActionOnAll

        protected final void performActionOnAll​(game.PlayerActionInvoker pai)
